Key Match Events: A 12th-inning bunt-fueled rally lifted the Oakland Athletics over the Houston Astros with a 4-3 win.
Ben Gamel worked a one-out walk in the bottom of the seventh inning, and Jon Singleton sliced the deficit in half with his first career triple.
Jose Altuve opened the bottom of the 12th with an RBI double that scored automatic runner Jason Heyward.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The Athletics (63-82) rallied against Hector Neris, the sixth pitcher of the game for the Astros.
Oakland left-hander JP Sears had his start bumped up one day after scheduled starter Osvaldo Bido was placed on the 15-day injured list earlier on Tuesday with right wrist flexor tendinitis.
Others: The game was played on September 11, 2024.
The Athletics' Shea Langeliers responded with a sacrifice fly to left that plated Brent Rooker for a 1-0 lead in the first inning.
Athletics reliever Tyler Ferguson allowed the Astros to claw back from a two-run deficit in the bottom of the seventh inning.
